H0.text: Cold temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H1.text: Mixed temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H2.text: Hot temperatures are the kind of weather psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

H3.text: Water temperatures are the kind of weather that psychrophiles need to grow and reproduce.

A4.text: Psychrophiles or cryophiles are extremophilic organisms that are capable of growth and reproduction in low temperatures, ranging from −20 °C (−4 °F) to 20 °C (68 °F).

A5.text: They can be contrasted with thermophiles, which are organisms that thrive at unusually high temperatures, and mesophiles at intermediate temperatures.
